did.unittitle: French WWI Prisoner of War Camp Newspapers

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Duke University. David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Newspapers for French prisoners of war held throughout Europe during World War I. Newspapers were intended for French prisoners of war during World War I, and were collected from a variety of different POW camps in Europe. This collection contains examples of 11 single issues, each from a different camp. Locations include the Camp D'Ohrdruf, Camps du Hanovre, Allemagne, Camp de Zossen, and others.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the French WWI Prisoner of War Camp NewsPapers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection is unprocessed; cataloged from accession records.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical Note
bioghist.p: Newspapers for French prisoners of war held throughout Europe during World War I.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Newspapers intended for French prisoners of war during World War I, collected from a variety of different POW camps in Europe. This collection contains examples of 11 single issues, each from a different camp. Locations include the Camp D'Ohrdruf, Camps du Hanovre, Allemagne, Camp de Zossen, and others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The history and provenance of these materials are unknown. They were transferred to the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library from Perkins Library in 2007. No additional arrangement or organization has been conducted at this point.
